meta.title: Forensic Medicine Test (The Champion Batch Hyderabad) - 03-05-2024 - 2024-05-03

questions.text: During a heated altercation in a public space, an individual is accused of physically assaulting another person, resulting in the victim sustaining a broken mandible. The incident, witnessed by several bystanders, prompts immediate police intervention. Given the severity of the injury and the circumstances surrounding the altercation, what action are the police most likely authorized to take against the accused individual?
A criminal can be charged in juvenile court if he is below ----- years of age?

Dr. Ray, a forensic specialist, is in a conundrum as he receives simultaneous summons from various courts for his expert testimony - all scheduled on the same day. With the summons spread across different levels of the judiciary and case types, he needs to determine which court holds the primary claim on his attendance. Considering the hierarchy and the nature of the cases, which court should Dr. Ray prioritize for his appearance?

options.label: A
options.text: Summon from the High Court in a civil case

options.label: B
options.text: Summon from the Session Court in a criminal case

options.label: C
options.text: Summon from the Session Court in a civil case

options.label: D
options.text: Summon from the Chief Judicial Magistrate in a civil case

questions.correct_answer: A. Summon from the High Court in a civil case
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Summon from the High Court in a civil case

questions.text: Leading questions are permitted only in:

Dr. Singh, a cardiologist in New Delhi, is under investigation after several complaints from patients regarding his prescription practices, which allegedly violate the nationally recognized medical code of ethics. He is accused of overprescribing medications in exchange for incentives from a pharmaceutical company. In the context of medical regulation in India, which authority(ies) is/are primarily responsible for issuing a formal warning to Dr. Singh?

A 15-year-old boy Gautam is accused of causing a grievous hurt to an elderly man in his neighborhood. The case of Gautam will be tried in a juvenile court which has a Juvenile justice board. Which of the following is true with respect to composition of juvenile justice board?

options.label: C
options.text: Judicial Magistrate of first class who must be a woman

questions.text: In the civil negligence case against a doctor who bears the onus of proof?

options.label: B
options.text: Police not under rank of sub inspector

questions.text: At a district hospital, a forensic expert is called to review a case involving a 30-year-old woman who underwent an appendectomy. Post-surgery, she experienced severe abdominal pain and subsequent investigations revealed a surgical sponge left inside her abdomen. Due to this, she developed a severe infection leading to extended hospitalization. The woman has filed a lawsuit against the operating surgeon. In this case, which legal principle suggests that the burden of proof for demonstrating the absence of negligence rests with the doctor?
Medical etiquette is related to:

options.label: B
options.text: Rules to be followed by doctors

questions.text: In a legal case involving a patient's medical treatment, the court requires information about the patient's medical condition and treatment history. However, the treating physician is concerned about the ethical and legal aspects of disclosing patient information, which is typically confidential. Under which legal concept can professional secrecy be divulged in a court of law without violating ethical standards?
Match the following:
In the primary dentition, which upper teeth appear earlier than lower teeth?
The most reliable criteria in Gustafson’s method of identification is
Which of the following method is based on age determination based on weight and height of the erupting teeth?
The drumstick shape in the image shown below helps to determine:
Angle of mandible is expected to least obtuse in which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Adult Male

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The least obtuse angle of the mandible is observed in adult males due to the fully developed and strong mandible structure. The angle tends to be more obtuse in children and elderly individuals.
  • ➤ The least obtuse angle of the mandible is observed in adult males due to the fully developed and strong mandible structure.
  • ➤ least obtuse angle of the mandible
  • ➤ adult males
  • ➤ The angle tends to be more obtuse in children and elderly individuals.

questions.text: Identify the true statement regarding corporobasal index of the sacrum?

options.label: A
options.text: Breadth of fifth lumbar vertebra X 100 breadth of all sacral vertebra

options.label: B
options.text: Breadth of first sacral vertebra X 100 / breadth of fifth lumbar vertebra

options.label: C
options.text: Breadth of fifth lumbar vertebra X 100 / breadth of base of sacrum

options.label: D
options.text: Breadth of first sacral vertebra X 100 / breadth of base of sacrum

questions.correct_answer: D. Breadth of first sacral vertebra X 100 / breadth of base of sacrum
questions.explanation: Ans. D)Breadth of first sacral vertebra X 100 / breadth of base of sacrum

questions.text: While performing the autopsy of a new-born, the forensic specialist noticed that the diaphragm is at a lower level. What is the inference from this finding?

options.label: A
options.text: The baby had phrenic nerve damage

options.label: B
options.text: The baby had not respired prior to death

options.label: C
options.text: The baby had respired prior to death

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing significant can be inferred from this finding

questions.correct_answer: C. The baby had respired prior to death
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The baby had respired prior to death

questions.text: You are a resident performing a postmortem examination under the supervision of the medical examiner. The body of a recently deceased individual shows several physiological changes. As part of your training, you are asked to identify the findings that are not typically associated with the early postmortem period. Which of the following is not considered an early sign of death?

During a training session in forensic medicine, a resident learns about the importance of analyzing the vitreous humor in determining the postmortem interval. Which constituent of the vitreous humor is most helpful in accurately estimating the postmortem interval?
The method of autopsy carried out en masse to remove from tongue to prostate is
Suspended animation may be seen with:
The image below of liver is seen in:
What type of smell is produced by the decomposed body from the given image?
Postmortem caloricity is seen in all except:
Direction of Impact in the image below?

options.label: C
options.text: Right to left side of arm

options.label: D
options.text: Left to right side of arm

questions.text: During a forensic examination, the team discovers a distinctive patterned injury on a victim's arm, consistent with human teeth marks. The injury appears as a series of indentations and abrasions forming a semicircular pattern. Given the nature of this injury, which is a common finding in assault cases and can provide crucial evidence regarding the assailant, the forensic expert categorizes this specific type of abrasion. What type of abrasion is a bite mark considered to be?

In a forensic investigation involving a case of alleged assault, the forensic expert is tasked with distinguishing between genuine and artificially produced injuries. One particular injury appears to be a bruise, but there's suspicion that it might have been artificially created to support false allegations. The expert considers various substances that could potentially be used to mimic the appearance of a bruise. Which substance is known to be used for producing artificial bruises?
Tailing of the Incised wound helps to know?
Identify the type of skull fracture sustained in a motorcycle accident?
All are components of gun-powder EXCEPT:
According to wound ballistics, A gunshot wound showing burning, blackening, tattooing around the wound, can be classified as:

In gunshot injury to skull with entry wound at right temporal region surrounded by abrasion collar & tattooing and an exit wound at left temporal region along with metal fragments of bullet inside the bullet track what can be used to determine the range of firing?
A gunshot case brought for autopsy shows an entry wound with inverted margins and the wound is surrounded by blackening and tattooing. Singed burnt hair was noted. What is the range of the weapon?

An 18-year-old girl committed suicide by hanging, after a fight with her boyfriend. On conducting the autopsy, the ligature mark is seen at the upper 1/3rd of the neck and she is seen to have a protruded tongue. One side eye is open and both the pupils are dilated. What is the cause for the open eye?

An autopsy was performed to find the cause of death of a person brought dead to the casualty. It showed abrasions on the neck, fracture of the thyroid cartilage and contused tissues in the neck. The cause of death is?

A man is killed by his brother over a property dispute. In post-mortem examination a finding similar to the one shown in this radiological picture is seen. What could be the most possible cause of death?
A dead born foetus does not have -
A 13-year-old girl was raped by her neighbor. She presents to the hospital with 25 weeks of pregnancy. What should not be done?

options.label: A
options.text: Examination by Male doctor with female attendant

options.label: B
options.text: Vaginal swab examination is not necessary

options.label: D
options.text: Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist

questions.correct_answer: D. Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist

questions.text: In autopsy the gastric mucosa shows the findings depicted in the picture below: What is the probable cause of death?

A laborer while working under hot sun collapsed with loss of consciousness and brought to the emergency department. On examination his body temperature was found to be 106F. The least likely finding is?

A concerned mother takes her daughter of 14 years age who was complaining of pain in the private parts to a gynecologist. On eliciting history, the girl admits she had consensual sexual intercourse with a neighbor and refuses to get examined. What should the gynecologist do? Document informed refusal Do not inform the police Counsel the mother and daughter Examine with necessary force Inform the police

A Forensic Expert is called to a crime scene where a potential sexual assault is suspected. The sheets from the scene do not visually reveal any obvious stains, but the pathologist knows that certain types of illumination can reveal traces of biological fluids that are not visible to the naked eye. They must choose the most appropriate method to detect these potential seminal stains for further analysis. Question: Which type of light should the Forensic Expert use to visualize invisible or faint seminal stains at the crime scene?

A 48-year-old forensic examiner is presented with a set of preserved clothing articles from a case that is 4 months old. Suspicion arises regarding the presence of aged seminal stains on the fabric. To establish the presence of semen, especially considering the potential degradation of the sample over time, which of the following biochemical tests should the examiner prioritize to yield reliable results?

A 10-year-old male child came to the casualty with difficulty in walking and pain in the perianal region. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, yellow needle-shaped crystals are seen under the microscope. What is the test done?
Identify the rules used as tests of insanity?
Psychological autopsy is?

options.label: A
options.text: Autopsy of brain and spinal cord

options.label: B
options.text: To inquire about the psychiatric illnesses of the deceased

options.label: C
options.text: Assessment of the mental state of deceased person before death

questions.correct_answer: C. Assessment of the mental state of deceased person before death
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Assessment of the mental state of deceased person before death

questions.text: During a high-profile court case, the jury is presented with the situation of a 40-year-old university professor who has been charged with the serious assault of a colleague. It comes to light during the trial that the professor has been battling untreated schizophrenia, characterized by profound auditory hallucinations and delusions. On the day in question, he was under the delusion that his colleague was a covert agent sent to harm him, leading to the assault. The defence argues that the professor's mental state at the time of the incident rendered him incapable of understanding his actions' nature or distinguishing right from wrong. Given these circumstances and applying the Legal Test of Insanity, how should the professor's criminal responsibility be assessed?

options.label: A
options.text: He is criminally responsible because he was conscious of his physical actions during the assault.

options.label: B
options.text: He is not criminally responsible due to his inability to comprehend the true nature of his actions because of his delusional perception.

options.label: C
options.text: He is criminally responsible because the act was a result of a deliberate decision, despite his mental illness.

options.label: D
options.text: He is criminally responsible because his mental illness does not excuse violent behavior.

questions.correct_answer: B. He is not criminally responsible due to his inability to comprehend the true nature of his actions because of his delusional perception.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) He is not criminally responsible due to his inability to comprehend the true nature of his actions because of his delusional perception.

questions.text: Which of these is false regarding Magnan syndrome?

In a rural clinic, a medical officer is faced with a case of acute poisoning. A 25-year-old patient has been brought in after ingesting an unknown substance at home. The medical officer needs to quickly administer an initial treatment to reduce the absorption of the poison. In preparing an emergency response, the medical officer considers the components of the universal antidote. Which of the following substances, commonly available in medical settings, is a part of this universal antidote and should be administered in this scenario?

A male patient presented to hospital with tachycardia, hypertension, palpitations and pupil dilatation. He Is found to be a substance abuser. Which of the following drug withdrawal can cause the following symptoms?
Identify the plant which produces a toxin of abuse potential?
What is the active principle of the poison shown in the image?
Which of the following chelating agents is recommended for acute Lead poisoning with signs of encephalopathy?

In a district hospital, a medical officer is presented with a 40-year-old male patient exhibiting signs of encephalopathy and abdominal discomfort. The patient's family reports that he has been involved in the renovation of old buildings, which includes the removal of old paint. Given the clinical presentation and the patient's occupational history, the medical officer suspects poisoning and considers the initiation of chelation therapy. For which type of poisoning is Disodium EDTA particularly indicated as an antidote?

A patient was brought to casualty with seizures. He had multiple episodes and was taking herbal medicines for the same. He was conscious in between the episodes. During the episodes, he had arching of his back. What is the likely cause?
Which of these is the correct match of plant poisons and their active principles:

A 15-year-old male presents to ED in a coma with CPR in progress. A friend found him in the schoolyard. His friend confesses that the patient has been depressed over the past several days. His initial labs reveal hypocalcemia and a severe metabolic acidosis. The urine shows calcium oxalate crystals. What was the toxic ingestion?

A 33-year-old male with attempted poisoning was brought to the casualty in a drowsy state. His pulse was 140/min, respiratory rate -30/min. His ABG showed metabolic acidosis. Urine analysis showed Calcium oxalate crystals. Identify the likely poison?
Treatment of choice for acute arsenic poisoning is?
A substance abuser was found on the roadside with low respiratory rate and with pinpoint pupils. Which of the following should be suspected in this drug abuser?

A 30-year-old woman is brought to the hospital by emergency medical services after being found unconscious in a park. She is unresponsive to verbal stimuli and is breathing very shallowly. Friends who were with her mention that she had been using drugs at a party earlier. Her breathing rate is 6 breaths per minute, and her pupils are constricted. Her skin is pale, and she feels cool to the touch. Which of the following substances is most likely responsible for her presentation?
Which of these is not a symptom of cocaine poisoning?
Amongst the options given below, which of these are not seen in cocaine poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: Tingling and numbness of hands and feet

questions.text: A farmer presented with history of ingestion of an unknown substance. He had increased sweating, lacrimation, diarrhea, muscle weakness, and tachycardia. What is the drug of choice for treatment?
Metal fume fever is commonly caused by?
Run-Amok' is caused by?
Arsenic is not found in which organs?
Activated charcoal is ineffective in poisoning of:

A Casualty medical officer is called to assess a patient who has ingested a toxic substance. During the assessment, the medical officer observes that the patient's urine has turned green. This unusual symptom raises concerns about the specific toxic substance involved. Which toxic substance is most likely responsible for the green-colored urine seen in this patient?

A 35-year-old patient arrives at the hospital emergency department presenting with gastrointestinal distress. The patient complains of severe abdominal pain, frequent vomiting, and watery diarrhea. During the physical examination, the medical team observes that the patient's stools emit an unusual faint glow. The patient appears disoriented and fatigued. The medical history reveals that the patient attended a local festival the previous day and consumed various food items there. The following exposures might be contributing to which substance toxication?
Gastric lavage can be performed in case of poisoning by:

A 40-year-old man is brought to the emergency department with symptoms of poisoning. He is conscious but in distress, and reports ingesting a substance about an hour ago. The medical officer notes a distinct smell from the patient's breath. Considering the nature of the substance ingested and the time since ingestion, the medical officer must decide on the appropriate decontamination procedure. For which of the following poisons, consistent with the patient's presentation, is gastric lavage particularly indicated?
All of the following features are seen in chronic arsenic poisoning except?

A neurosurgeon at a private hospital has a standing agreement with a referring primary care physician. For every patient referred to the neurosurgeon, the primary care physician receives a certain percentage of the surgical fee. This arrangement has come under scrutiny during a routine audit by the healthcare regulatory authority. What is this controversial practice called?

options.label: C
options.text: Filing an FIR against the patient for not paying the fee
